          The JmDNS service type of Impromptu Pie
static double RADIUS
          Radius of the pie, the shorter half of width and height, minus peer name Probably should convert font size (in point) to pixels
static double SEG_FACTOR
          Magic number used in calculating the relative radius for each ring
static double SEMI_CIRCLE
          Degress for a semisphere
static int SIZE_FONT_DESCRIPTION
          The font size for the desciption window
static int SIZE_FONT_DOT
          The font size for the file name
static int SIZE_FONT_PEER
          The font size for the peer name
static int SIZE_MARGIN_PEER
          Pixels between the outer of the pie and the names of peers This number (pixels) should be based on SIZE_FONT_PEER (points)
static int SIZE_RING_PEER
          Outside which ring the name of the peer should be put 0 is outside the pie, 1 is inside the colorful marker Tweak SIZE_RING_PEER and SIZE_MARGIN_PEER to increase coverage of eatable pie
static java.lang.String SIZE_STROKE_WIDTH
          The size of the outer stroke of the dot
static int SIZE_VIEW_HEIGHT

          The title of the client application
static java.lang.String YANCEES_CONFIGURATION_FILE_SECONDARY
          The secondary yancees configuration file, when we want to run the server and the client separately.

SIZE_MARGIN_PEER

Constant Field Values

SIZE_RING_PEER

public static final int SIZE_RING_PEER
Outside which ring the name of the peer should be put 0 is outside the pie, 1 is inside the colorful marker Tweak SIZE_RING_PEER and SIZE_MARGIN_PEER to increase coverage of eatable pie

See Also:

PIE_PORT_NONE

The Pie does not really have a port

See Also:
Constant Field Values

YANCEES_CONFIGURATION_FILE_SECONDARY

public static final java.lang.String YANCEES_CONFIGURATION_FILE_SECONDARY
The secondary yancees configuration file, when we want to run the server and the client separately. This is for the Pie client, since the Server/Peer is the normal way to start Impromptu and uses YANCEES_CONFIGURATION_FILE.

See Also:

getSize

public static java.awt.Dimension getSize()
Get the size of the pie. Default to view size if user has not changed it.

Returns:
the size of the pie

getPosition

public static java.awt.Point getPosition()
Get the position of the pie. Default to the upper left corner if a user has not changed it.

Returns:
the position of the pie

getPieColor

public static java.lang.String getPieColor()
Get the color for the local peer

Returns:
the color for the local peer.

getPieColorBytes

public static byte[] getPieColorBytes()
Get the rgb bytes for the color for the local peer

Returns:
null if there is no color, a three byte array of [rr][gg][bb] if there is one.

getSizeRingPeer

public static int getSizeRingPeer()
Get outside which ring the name of the peer should be put

Returns:
0 if the name is outside the pie, 1 if the name is inside the colorful marker

getShowDescription

public static boolean getShowDescription()
Get whether the description window is enabled

Returns:
true if enabled, false if disabled

getFollowDot

public static boolean getFollowDot()
Get whether the description window should follow the dot

Returns:
true to follow, false not to follow

getDragWithDelegate

public static boolean getDragWithDelegate()
Get whether to use a delgate for dragging

Returns:
true for using a delegate, false for using the dot directly

public static java.lang.String getDestinationDrive()

the drive letter or the mount point
